author: S Prasad
text:
Treasure hunt covers 10 important places, mostly tourist spots

Ranju Joseph, Regional Manager of Hankook Tyres, flags off Adventure Pondicherry Treasure Hunt organised by the Rotary Club of Pondicherry Port at the new port grounds on Sunday —Photo: T. Singaravelou

Adventure Pondicherry, a treasure hunt car rally organised by the Rotary Club of Pondicherry Port, provided participants an opportunity to explore unknown facets of the city.

The rally began at the new port grounds in Uppalam and covered a distance of 45 km and culminated at Aroma gardens in Edayanchavady in Auroville.

The rally was flagged off by Ranju Joseph, Regional Manager of Hankook Tyres.

“The whole treasure hunt was in riddles, covering 10 important places mostly tourist spots. Each team, consisting of two to four members, was given a set of clues which they had to solve based on an image to reach the next level,” said Antony Prosper Anandaraj, secretary of Rotary club of Pondicherry Port.

“We had scanned most of the events conducted in the past and identified lesser known places in the city and its suburbs,” he said. The treasure hunt consisted of 10 clues and the participants had to complete each of the tasks in sequence within two-and-a-half hours.

The participants also had to get their entry sheet stamped and signed by the organising team at the locations en route.

There were more points for teams that followed the clues in order, Mr. Anandaraj said. The first prize was won by Thirumavalavan, followed by Muthukrishnan and Sandeep Jain in the second and third places respectively.

The Hindu was the media partner for the event.
